trial_identification.studytitle: Experience in International Classification of Diseases (ICD) and International Classification of Functionality, Disability and Health (ICF) use for mapping health information
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Brazilian experience in International Classification of Diseases (ICD) and International Classification of Functionality, Disability and Health (ICF) use for mapping health information in patients with disabilities attending physical therapy school

conditions.healthcondition: International Classification of Functionality, Disability and Health Mapping

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Research that is not of generic health relevance and not applicable to specific health categories listed above

interventions.interventions: Health-related information was identified by mean of an interview that it were conducted amongst any patient randomly when each observed health-related aspect was codified as it was determined by the International Classification of Functionality, Disability and Health (ICF). The observation was done for 2 months and participants took part in on interview only. Participant subjects were defined by sampling among patients in treatment in the physical therapy school.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Number of observations codified by International Classificantion of Diseases (ICD) and International classification fo Functionality, Disability and Health (ICF)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Rate of diseases per subjects and rate of health-related aspects per subjects

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Subjets with disabilities who present to physical therapy school for evaluation and treatment.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Don't be being attended in the physical therapy school.

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Universidade Municipal de Sao Caetano do Sul
sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Santo Antonio Avenue, 50, Centro, Sao Caetano do Sul, Sao Paulo, 09521-160

fundingsource.fundingname: Universidade Municipal de Sao Caetano do Sul
fundingsource.fundingaddress: Santo Antonio Avenue, 50, Centro, Sao Caetano do Sul, Sao Paulo, 09521-160

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The present study aim to provide health information by mean of international classifications of the World Health Organization to observe the distribution pattern of health-related aspects. The descritive information could be used to provide correlations between codes of both international classifications and describe a brazilian experiancy in the use of this classifications.
